sentence.Network_en: Predatory pricing by large supermarkets was threatening the livelihood of smaller businesses.
sentence.Network_cn: 大型超市的掠夺性价格正威胁着小商店的生计。

sentence.Network_en: She was safe from predatory birds on the verandah.
sentence.Network_cn: 在阳台上她不会遭到猛禽的袭击.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense relating to plundering): from Latin praedatorius, from praedator, 'plunderer', (see predator)

entry.def: Predatory animals live by killing other animals for food.

example.tran: 像鹰一样的捕食性动物

entry.tran: 掠夺性的；弱肉强食的；损人利己的
entry.def: Predatory people or organizations are eager to gain something out of someone else's weakness or suffering.

example.ex: People who run small businesses are frightened by the predatory behaviour of the banks.
example.tran: 小公司经营者被银行的掠夺行为吓坏了。

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by plundering or pillaging or marauding;
2. living by preying on other animals especially by catching living prey;
3. living by or given to victimizing others for personal gain;

sentences.sentence: "a predatory, insensate society in which innocence and decency can prove fatal"- Peter S. Prescott
"a predacious kind of animal--the early geological gangster"- W.E.Swinton

auth_sentence.content: It also gives consumers new protections against predatory lenders.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It also gives consumers new protections against predatory lenders.

auth_sentence.content: On the Upper Rhine...an indecisive predatory war was carried on.
